notesStmt.note: Title from title page (f. 1r); alternate title Navarātrapūjājapahomādividhi from colophon (f. 5v-6r).
6 leaves foliated 1-5, [6], upper left and lower right verso.
Dated saṃvat 1868 aśvinamāse śuklapakṣe tithau 2 (Friday, 4 October 1811 A.D.) (f. 6r).
Scribe is Nārāyaṇabhaṭ Abāne Tulāpurkara the son of Bālakṛṣṇa Tulāpurkara (f. 6r).
Mistakes blacked out; some corrections and additions in margins.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Manuscript used as a guide for proper procedures of the nine-nights festival beginning at the new moon in the month of Aśvin (September/October). Includes a discussion of related rites and recitations, including the worship (pūjā) of the goddess Dūrgā and other deities, to be performed at the proper times of day in alignment with astrological bodies.
